content.description: Two blocks are connected by a rope, as shown above. The masses of the blocks are <math alttext="5 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the upper block and <math alttext="10 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the lower block. An upward applied force of magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> acts on the upper block.
content.question: The system is moving and accelerating upward. A pair of scissors cuts the rope. Which of the following describes the motion of the <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> block immediately after the rope has been cut?

choices.label: The block continues to move upward and to accelerate upward.
The block begins to move downward but continues to accelerate upward.
The block continues to move upward but begins to accelerate downward.
The block begins to move downward and to accelerate downward.

content.answer: The block continues to move upward but begins to accelerate downward.
